title: Bacopa Monnieri
cleaned_text: herb that has been used in traditional medicine for longevity and cognitive enhancement. Supplementation can improve memory, at least in the short-term, and there may be some mental health benefits. 1. Sources and Composition 1.1 Sources Bacopa monnieri (of the family Scrophulariaceae) is a creeping marsh plant used in Ayurveda for neurological rejuvenation, and has implications for memory enhancement and anxiety. [[6]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-6) It is one of the more well renowned herbs alongside [Ashwagandha](/supplements/ashwagandha/) and Jatamansi, [[7]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-7) and is most commonly referred to as Brahmi [[8]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-8) [[9]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-9) (although it may also be called Jalabrahmi [[10]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-10) since the term Brahmi may also refer to a particular combination of bacopa monnieri and [Gotu Kola](/supplements/gotu-kola/)). It is classified as Aindri to its neuroactive properties [[11]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-11) and as Medhya Rasayana due to its rejuvenative properties on the nervous system. [[10]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-10) The main traditional usages of Bacopa Monnieri are for anxiety, depression, learning, and 'various neuropharmacological disorders' [[12]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-12) whereas it has also been used for antiinflammatory, antipyretic, astringent, laxative, cough, poisoning, and blood disorders. [[13]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-13) It has traditionally been given to children as well to boost brain power. [[12]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-12) Bacopa Monnieri is commonly consumed with some form of animal fat, which goes in line with the herb's fat solubility. Many times, it is paired with the herb Centella Asiatica, known as Mandookparni or Gotu Kola. The pair is sometimes mixed in milk and drank, which is supposedly a common method of delivery for children. A general 'Brain Tonic' that is highly heralded in Ayurveda 1.2 Components As a herb, Bacopa Monnieri contains: - Bacoside A and B [[11]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-11)with A being up to 8% of the dry leaves by weight when fresh. [[12]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-12)Other Bacosides may be present in contents ranging [[16]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-16) [[17]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-17)has been measured at 0.12% Monnieri to be 3.18ug/mL for the ethanolic extract and 3.71ug/mL for the aqueous extract. [[10]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-10) The in 85.63ug/mL aqueous. [[10]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-10) These compounds confer anti-oxidant capabilities to Bacopa, and of relatively equal potency to that of Mandookparni. [[10]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-10) Upon acid hydrolysis (of which includes gastric digestion) the parent Bacosides break down into three subcategories. - Bacogenins (A1, A2 [[11]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-11) [[19]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-19) Thus, the bioactivity of the above 14 compounds is what is generally referred to as 'Bacosides A and B'. [[20]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-20) About one third of the total above weight is Bacopaside I. [[21]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-21) All bacosides and bacopasides share a similar base structure, but vary due to different functional groups attached to the 'R' denotations on the diagrams below. Functional changes on the sugar moieties can change the effects of the glycosides as well. Of these, the most bioactive components appear to be Bacoside A3, Bacopaside [[10]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-10) [[22]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-22) The Bacosides A and B are what you should be concerned about putting in your mouth, but in the body they get metabolized into a variety of components that all appear to have bioactivities. Some sterols and flavonoids also exist alongside the Bacosides, but their significance is unknown 1.3 Stability Temperatures of 40-60°C (104-140°F) appear to be able to slowly degrade Bacopasides over time, whereas heat exposure up to 80°C (176°F) can rapidly decrease Bacopaside content. [[23]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-23) Proper storage of Bacopa Monnieri is at 30°C (86°F) or less, with a relative humidity of 65% or less. [[20]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-20) Not too stable around heat, advisable to keep in a cool and dark location 2. Pharmacology 2.1 Stomach In the stomach and at doses ranging from 10-100mg/kg bodyweight, Bacopa Monnieri extract (via the Bacoside A component) appears to protect against ulcers induced by drugs (aspirin, [alcohol](/supplements/alcohol/)), stress such as cold-shock [[24]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-24) and Heliobacter Pylori bacteria. [[25]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-25) Some repair of the stomach lining has been noted. [[24]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-24) [[26]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-26) Appears to have slight protective effects against ulcer formation from all tested insults, and might be able to regenerate stomach lining a bit 2.2 Phase I Enzyme Interactions When tested in vitro, bacopa monnieri extract has been noted to have noncompetitive (IC50 of 2mg/mL), and the inhibition of the first four CYP enzymes are thought to be practically relevant for oral ingestion as intestinal (but not liver) concentrations of bacopa (assuming a 300mg a day dose) are estimated to be around 600µg/mL and this concentration is sufficient to reduce activity to below 10% in vitro. [[27]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-27) When tested in isolation, select bacosides (bacoside A and A3, bacopaside I, II, and X, and bacopasaponin C) failed to have any inhibitory actions towards any CYP enzyme. [[27]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-27) There is relatively potent inhibition towards three CYP enzymes known to mediate metabolism of some drugs, and the inhibition is thought to be practically relevant in the intestines where bacopa can accumulate without absorption. At this moment in time the exact molecules mediating this inhibition are not known 3. Neurology 3.1 Memory Bacopa Monnieri extract may be able to increase memory formation by the enzyme Tryptophan Hydroxylase (TPH2) and increasing the expression of the serotonin transporter (SERT). [[28]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-28) Bacopa does appear to have some interactions with the serotonin system, and may have downstream effects on the cholinergic system through this. [[29]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-29) [[30]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-30) Additionally, dendritic intersections and branching points in neurons have been noted to be proliferated with Bacopa Monnieri supplementation after 4 and 6 weeks, but failed to have any changes at 2 weeks. [[31]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-31) This neuronal growth effect occurs in adult rats [[32]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-32) and younger rats undergoing growth spurts, [[33]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-33) and occur in areas of the brain known to be involved with memory, such as the hippocampus [[31]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-31) and the basolateral amygdala. [[33]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-33) [[32]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-32) These changes coincide with memory enhancement seen in human studies, where usage for under 2 weeks is not associated with any cognitive enhancement but additional usage is; implicating dendritic enhancement as a probable explanation for memory enhancement. Mechanism of memory enhancement has not been completely solidified, but appears to be related to either enhancing neuronal transmission (via enhancing dendritic proliferation) or through interactions with the serotonergic system (which then influence acetylcholinergic transmission). These effects do not appear to require cognitive decline or the elderly to work, and thus suggest Bacopa can benefit all ages Enhancing neuronal transmission and proliferating dendrites may enhance memory map formation Bacopa, in healthy persons, has been successful in beneficially affecting the retention of learned information. It may be able to reduce the rate of short term forgetting (ie. increase encoding of information) [[34]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-34) while increasing retention speeds. [[35]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-35) In addition to rate of learning, Bacopa Monnieri shows some promise at 300mg daily for improving memory, verbal learning and delayed recall. [[36]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-36) This has been repeated in healthy persons between 18 and 60 with two doses of 150mg daily. [[37]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-37) In regards to persons with impaired memory, low dose Bacopa (125mg daily) appears to be somewhat effective. [[38]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-38) Bacopa has also been implicated in helping children aged 6-12 with ADHD, but this study used a blend of herbs cannot be placed on any in isolation. [[39]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-39) These two studies are less able to be extrapolated to healthy persons, but should still be noted. Not all research is conclusively solid, as some studies do note no difference from placebo at therapeutically relevant dosages, [[40]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-40) although this study was critiqued on suggesting that the null results were due to 'low doses'. [[41]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-41) The former study was conducted at 300mg Bacopa and 120mg Gingko for 2-4 weeks, which is shorter in time to other studies but at a similar dosage. Beyond this study, one other study has noted no effects with a single administration, suggesting that longer term supplementation is needed. [[42]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-42) Many of these studies have been subject to Meta-Analysis, where it was concluded that Bacopa shows preliminary efficacy in improving general memory (9 out of 17 measured parameters) with little influence on other parameters of cognition. [[43]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-43) In a study analyzing the comparative effect sizes of Bacopa, [Panax Ginseng](/supplements/panax-ginseng/), and Modafinil it was found that although Modafinil and Bacopa were both potent they were at different parameters; Modafinil increasing speed of information processing much better than Bacopa, which tended to reliably increase cognition after chronic dosing. [[44]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-44) There is a surprising amount of human interventions on Bacopa Monnieri for being an Ayurvertic herb, and the majority of them note positive results. No longer term studies have been done, but the evidence at the time is very promising and is in line with the traditional claims of Bacopa Monnieri being a memory enhancer Beyond enhancing memory, Bacopa has been implicated numerous times in reducing amnesia (memory loss due to stressor) via a collection of mechanisms. [[29]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-29) [[30]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-30) [[45]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-45) [[46]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-46) [[47]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-47) 3.2 Cognition In (not memory per se), Bacopa at 450mg daily for 3 months has failed to significantly improve performance on an Inspection Time Task (discrimination) and on a Stroop test (attention and interference). [[48]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-48) 450mg Bacopa daily for 3 months in otherwise healthy persons has failed to significantly influence performance on a Rapid Visual Information Processing task (RVIP). [[48]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-48) 3.3 Serotonin Bacopa has some implications with serotonergic signalling in models of epilepsy (See Epilepsy subsection of Neurology) where receptor kinetics are normalized under the influence of 150mg/kg Bacopa Monnieri oral ingestion in pilocarpine-induced epilepsy. Beyond that, Bacopa Monnieri has been found to increase serotonin levels in the hippocampus of treated animals [[28]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-28) [[6]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-6) as well as increasing to SERT mRNA but both the increases in SERT expression, Tryptophan Hydroxylase activity, and serotonin levels appear to decline with age, where rats that are 53 days postnatal do not experience increases in either, whereas 19 and 27 days postnatal still experience increases. [[28]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-28) In this study, memory was not tested across the age spans. Appears to increase serotonin content and effects, may be related to memory formation, and its effects appear to be sensitive to age 3.4 Dopamine Bacopa Monnieri has been investigated for its ability to reduce dopaminergic neuronal death seen in Parkinsons diseases, as evidenced by a genetically transfected C.Elegans line [[49]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-49) and mouse brains. [[50]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-50) Treatment with Bacopa Monnieri at 40-80mg/kg bodyweight in rats subject to both acute and chronic stress (to assess Bacopa's adaptogenic effects) found that the depletion of dopamine and serotonin associated with chronic stress did not occur with Bacopa supplementation, although the decrease in noradrenaline was unaffected. [[51]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-51) This preservation of dopamine levels has been seen with rotenone-induced neurotoxicity, which should normally deplete dopamine but doesn't in the presence of Bacopa Monnieri. [[52]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-52) [[50]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-50) Through these studies, it is plausible to suggest that Bacopa reduces stress onto dopaminergic neurons that would otherwise then deplete dopamine, although the mechanism of protection is unknown. Bacopa has also shown anti-dopaminergic effects in the striatum (location associated with [caffeine](/supplements/caffeine/) and morphine, and highly associated with dopamine induced locomotion) and prevented surges in dopamine when fed at a low dose of 5-15mg/kg bodyweight daily. [[53]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-53) This anti-dopaminergic effect may be useful in situations of drug dependence [[53]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-53) Additionally, one study measuring levels of dopamine in the hindbrain noted statistically significant (91% of control). [[28]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-28) Although no mechanisms have been found out yet, it appears Bacopa Monnieri may nicely regulate dopamine. Although theoretically it could work against compounds that induce a dopamine spike in the striatum such as [caffeine], this negation may reduce drug dependence and dopamine-induced locomotion (running in circles from caffeine) 3.5 Acetylcholine and Cholinergic Signalling One study measuring hindbrain levels of acetylcholine noted an increase to 110% of the control rats. [[28]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-28) Bacopa Monnieri also appears to have anticholinesterase properties by inhibiting the acetylcholinesterase enzyme, but an IC50 value could not be calculated as 50% inhibition was not observed; thus these effects may be either weak or irrelevant. [[54]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-54) It has been implicated in reversing amnesia induced by anti-cholinergic drugs (scopolamine) at 120mg/kg oral ingestion, both retrograde and anterograde amnesia, which is the first study to link previous literature on amnesia to cholinergic transmission. [[30]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-30) Interestingly, this study ran for 7 days only and did not note any benefit to normal acquisition or retrieval of memory (in line with previous reports suggesting up to 2-4 weeks are needed for effects), suggesting the mechanisms behind reversing amnesia are distinct from that of inducing memory promotion. [[30]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-30) Other protective effects, such as a decrease in neuronal death in an animal model of Alzheimer's disease, have been noted. [[55]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-55) Although Bacopa Monnieri technically does increase acetylcholine and protect from Alzheimer's disease, there are not too many studies investigating these interactions and the observed interactions are fairly weak. Acetylcholine remains a possible explanation for some effects, but is not a promising avenue of research for Bacopa Monnieri. Protective effects seen may be secondary to anti-oxidant monnieri ethanolic did not appear to significantly influence levels of glutamate (despite beneficially influencing memory formation). [[28]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-28) Furthermore, bacopa monnieri does not appear to protect neurons from glutamate-induced neurotoxicity at concentrations able to preserve the cell from beta-amyloid toxicity. [[56]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-56) When looking at levels of glutamate itself, there does not appear to be any significant modifications relative to control In a rat model of schizophrenia, administration of bacopa was able to increase concentrations of the vesicular glutamate transporter type 1 (VGLUT1) which was associated with improvements in the discrimination ratio [[57]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-57) and in epileptic rats the decrease in the metabotropic glutamate-8 receptor mRNA expression [[58]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-58) and NMDA R1 [[59]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-59) are nearly normalized to control. There appear to be interactions with glutamate receptors and transporters, although due to all evidence currently taking place in models of cognitive ailments the interactions of Bacopa and glutaminergic neurotransmission in otherwise healthy persons is uncertain 3.7 Epilepsy Bacopa has been shown to have various benefits in the treatment of epilsepsy [[60]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-60) such as reducing convulsion occurrence (Brahmi Ghrithan is Bacopa Monnieri paired with Ghee). [[61]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-61) It seems to exert these actions, in part, via changes in the GABA receptor subtypes in the hippocampus [[62]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-62) and striatum [[63]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-63) may be due to the Bacoside-A content [[64]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-64) [[60]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-60) and are mediated through reducing the activity of the PNS. [[65]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-65) Bacopa Monnieri has also been shown to upregulate expression of a certain type of presynaptic glutamate receptor, mGluR8, [[58]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-58) which is downregulated during epilepsy. [[66]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-66) mGlu receptors are believed to be a protective mechanism from excitotoxicity, and their downregulation is concurrent with hyperexcitation. pilocarpine-induced epilepsy, Bacopa Monnieri at 150mg/kg daily for 15 days was able to upregulate mRNA transcription rates of mGluR8 to near control levels [[58]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-58) and this has been confirmed by other researchers. [[59]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-59) Similar to downregulation of mGluR8 in epilepsy, Serotonin receptors (5-HT2C subset) are downregulated in the cerebellum during and promptly reversed by Bacopa Monnieri, [[68]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-68) and upregulated in the hippocampus during epilepsy and also reversed by Bacopa Monneri. [[69]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-69) Both of these studies on serotonin receptor binding were done by the same research group and released within a month of each other, and using 150mg/kg dry weight Bacopa leaves. When Bacopa was fed to control rats without epilepsy, no effects were seen on 5-HT2C receptors. [[68]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-68) [[69]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-69) 3.8 Stress As an adaptogen, Bacopa Monnieri can reduce the effects of physiological stress when pre-loaded. [[70]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-70) It has been shown to reduce HSP70 expression (a biomarker of stress) in response to stress in all brain regions, but most significantly in the hippocampus; returning values in the hippocampus and cortex to near control levels, and the cerebellum about half-way to control. [[13]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-13) When 20mg/kg and 40mg/kg tested, no significance dose-response occurred Bacopa Monnieri, at 40mg/kg bodyweight in rats, has been noted to modulate the stress response rather than merely suppress it. [[13]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-13) When Bacopa was administered at 20-40mg/kg bodyweight, an increase in HSP70 was noted (15-17% in hippocampus, 44-51% in cortex, 65-83% in cerebellum) when the stress was not applied; these changes were not statistically significant, and were numerically about a third the HSP70 stress response invoked by perceived stresses without Bacopa Intervention. [[13]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-13) The authors hypothesized that Bacopa induced gene expression of stress, which prepared the rats for the perceived stress and minimized its potency. When measuring PROD (7-pentoxyresorun-o-dealkylase) and EROD (7-ethoxyresorun-o-deethylase), Bacopa monnieri at 20 and 40mg/kg seem to elevate it to the same extent that stress does, but Bacopa ingested during stress appears to return PROD levels closer to baseline; reasons unknown. [[13]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-13) In looking at neurotransmitter levels, Bacopa Monneiri (40-80mg/kg) is able to reduce changes seen with dopamine and serotonin when a short-term stress is present, but is ineffective at preventing a rise in adrenaline; [[51]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-51) in chronic stress, Bacopa can prevent reductions in serotonin, dopamine, and adrenaline [[51]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-51) and was equally effective as was American ginseng (Panax quniquefolium) at 100mg/kg, similar to their comparisons on depression and anxiety. [[71]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-71) Bacopa Monnieri appears to be effective at reducing the biochemical effects of a perceived stress, assuring its status as an adaptogen. It seems to be protective against acute and chronic stress as well At least one acute study using 320mg Bacopa Monneiri extract (CDRI 08) has noted that Bacopa acutely enhanced performance in a Cognitive Demand Battery (CDB) of tests. This study noted that while Bacopa failed to acutely influence fatigue or stress at this dose it attenuated the rate of performance decline associated with CDB (usually attributed to neural fatigue). [[72]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-72) 3.9 Neuroprotection Bacopa has been noted to, in rats, reduce Superoxide Dismutase (SOD) levels by 2.4-fold in the hippocampus at 20mg/kg oral ingestion, without significantly affecting other areas of the brain. [[13]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-13) This study had measurements at day 7, yet it appears that testing later at 2-3 weeks (coinciding with when memory enhancement is seen in humans) SOD levels, as well as other anti-oxidant enzymes such as glutathione peroxidase and catalase, are increased in the hippocampus as well as other brain regions such as the frontal cortex and striatum. [[73]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-73) Bacopa Monnieri supplementation can reduce oxidative damage from aluminum and prevent an increase in cognitive iron stores in cases of overload. [[74]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-74) These effects are also seen with mercury, in which Bacopa Monnieri appears to reduce oxidative damage from mercury on brain tissue in vivo where near pre-testing levels of damage were achieved with 40mg/kg bodyweight, although full protection was not seen. [[75]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-75) In general, Bacopa Monnieri appears to protect the brain from the damage induced by excessive mineral status. [[76]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-76) [[77]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-77) [[78]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-78) There was a past contamination of mercury to Bacopa Monnieri, but is atypical; [[79]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-79) Bacopa Monnieri supplements do not tend to have mercury contamination. Effective in reducing the oxidative and adverse effects of minerals on the brain, specifically iron overload; there is a notion that Bacopa has mercury in it, and one crop in the past did. Irrelevant point now, as aside from it not being a common occurrence Bacopa also protects from mercury-induced neural damage 3.10 Neuroinflammation Bacopa Monnieri has been implicated in reducing neural inflammation associated with aging over a period of three months, and may exert a neurological anti-aging effect. [[80]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-80) Bacopa Monnieri at 200mg/kg (large dose) was associated with IL-1 and TNF- being reduced in older age (22% and 25.7% less IL-1 and TNF-, respectively, in the Bacopa treated groups) and having the elevation associated with aging suppressed in all experimental groups. IFN- was not significantly affected. These anti-inflammatory effects have been seen in vitro [[81]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-81) and is attributed to the steroidal saponins (the bacosides). Bacopa Monnieri is associated with preventing beta-amyloid pigmentation build-up and may be a therapeutic approach to Alzheimer's. [[8]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-8) [[82]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-82) It may decrease beta-amyloid pigmentation through controlling oxidation (from lipids, metals, and ROS) and inhibiting lipoxygenase activity. [[82]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-82) It is dose dependent, and 100mcg ethanolic extract of Bacopa Monnieri 58mcg [Vitamin E](/supplements/vitamin-e/). [[76]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-76) 3.11 Anxiety and Depression Despite the traditional usage for Anxiety and Depression, minimal human studies exist; persons over the age of 65 taking 300mg Bacopa Monnieri (55% Bacosides) experienced a decrease in both anxiety and depression in a double-blinded study [[71]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-71) although 450mg of Bacopa for 3 months in otherwise healthy males with no baseline anxiety failed to find a significant effect. [[48]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-48) Bacopasides I and II, as well as bacopasaponin C, all show anti-depressant effects in mice. [[83]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-83) [[84]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-84) Depressive symptoms in epilepsy have been reversed with Bacopa Monnieri in research animals as well, as assessed by forced swim test [[69]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-69) 3.12 Cerebral Blood Flow Bacopa Monnieri has been implicated in increasing cerebral blood flow independent of overall blood pressure at a dose of 40mg/kg bodyweight in rats; [[85]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-85) it can also decrease blood pressure (both systolic and diastolic) independent of heart rate via vasodilation, and appear to be related to Bacoside A3 and Bacopaside II. [[86]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-86) It appears to be involved in releasing nitric oxide from the endothelium. [[86]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-86) 3.13 Pain Bacopa Monnieri appears to have antinociceptive properties at high doses (80-160mg/kg bodyweight in rats, aqueous extract). [[87]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-87) These effects are inhibited by [yohimbine](/supplements/yohimbine/) HCl, atenolol, and Cyproheptadine; showing that Bacopa's antinociceptive effects at high doses seem to be mediated through a combination of opiodergic, serotonergic, and adrenergic mechanisms. [[87]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-87) 3.14 Children Bacopa Monnieri has traditionally been given to children to boost brain power, alongside Gotu Kola and mixed with some milk. Out of all the human evidence on Bacopa, the one study currently looking at children is too confounded with other herbs to answer research questions on Bacopa [[39]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-39) but did not show any signs of toxicity. Another study cited here [[12]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-12) yet not indexed in Medline suggests that 350mg crude bacopa daily improved reaction times, memory, and general cognition relative to placebo. [[88]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-88) In studies on pre-pubertal animals, mice fed Bacopa at 0.5-1% of the diet (highest dose that mice would eat) for 4 weeks [[12]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-12) showed increases in anti-oxidant defense enzymes (Catalase by 26%, Glutathoine Peroxidase by 22%, SOD by MDA (15-21%) ROS (18-25%) and hydroperoxide (34-40%); these reductions in oxidants occurred in the cytosol and the mitochondria of tested neurons. [[12]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-12) The neurons were protected from toxic insult by 3-NPA, and no noticeable toxicity was noted in these mice. [[12]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-12) The memory-enhancing effects were also seen when orally administered to 10-day old rat pups at 20, 40, and 80mg/kg bodyweight with the extract at near 10% Bacosides A and B for 6 weeks were able to increase memorization of maze patterns and improve cognition more than controls, but 40mg/kg was needed at minimum as 20mg/kg was not statistically significant. [[89]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-89) Limited studies on children and youth; the one human study really cannot answer any question on Bacopa itself due to confounds. It appears to be effective in children at the same oral dose, efficacy, and mechanisms as adults and the elderly; safety is understudied, but no adverse effects were reported in the one human study and it has traditionally been given to children at 300mg dry leaves daily 4. Interactions with Glucose Metabolism 4.1 Blood Glucose At an oral dose of 20-100mg/kg bodyweight in rats, Bacopa Monnieri extract does not significantly influence blood glucose. [[26]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-26) One study noted that Bacosine, a compound in Bacopa Monnieri that is not one of the standard Bacosides (A and B) might have insulin mimetic properties. [[15]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-15) Oral intake of 10-25mg/kg bodyweight Bacosine (not whole bacopa) in alloxan-induced diabetic rats only, with no changes in non-diabetic rats. [[15]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-15) Subsequently, this reduced levels of MDA (from alloxan) and hemoglobin glycosylation (from oxidation), the latter with an IC50 of 7.44ug/mL which is comparable to alpha-tocopherol, the main [Vitamin E](/supplements/vitamin-e/) molecule. These latter effects are attributed to Bacopa's anti-oxidant ability. The effects of Bacosine acting like insulin may be dependent on either diabetes, or on higher than basal blood sugar (as the cited study was performed in a fasted state). [[15]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-15) Regardless, Bacosine is around a 0.12% concentration by weight in the dry leaves, making an oral dose of 10-25mg/kg bodyweight highly unlikely. Probably irrelevant given the low content of Bacosine in Bacopa Monnieri 5. Interactions with Hormones 5.1 Testosterone At 250mg/kg bodyweight oral ingestion of Bacopa Monnieri in mice for up to 56 days, no significant effects on [testosterone](/outcomes/testosterone/) levels are observed. [[90]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-90) 5.2 Thyroid A 50% ethanolic extract of Bacopa Monnieri at an oral dose of 200mg/kg daily for 15 days resulted in a 42% increase in serum T4 hormone concentration (with T3 not being significantly affected) which was a similar increase observed with 1,000mg/kg Aegle marmelos although the latter was associated with a sharp decrease of T3; the [Aloe vera](/supplements/aloe-vera/) group at 150mg/kg experienced a decrease, while the increase of T4 by Bacopa Monnieri was significantly less than the active control of 0.5mg/kg T4 itself (165% increase in T4; 50% increase in T3). [[91]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-91) 6. Interactions with Sexuality 6.1 Male Fertility A study on male mice with 250mg/kg bodyweight Bacopa noted that it was able to transiently suppress fertility when it was being taken over 28 and 56 days (two times points of testing), sperm parameters appeared to be unanimously depressed. [[90]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-90) When measured in the cauda epididymidis, reductions were seen in sperm motility (56% of control), spermatozoa count (54% of control), and (58% of control); the number of histologically abnormal spermatozoa increased significantly by 2.6 fold. [[90]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-90) Interestingly, Libido was unaffected and [testosterone](/outcomes/testosterone/) was not adversely affected either, and although all effects were seen at the first measurement period at 28 days, all parameters normalized 56 days after treatment (only tested period). [[90]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-90) These effects on sperm are similar to what is seen with Curcuma Longa (source of [Curcumin](/supplements/curcumin/)) at 600mg/kg, suggesting the two may be complementary in being anti-fertility agents. [[92]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-92) Possible anti-fertility effects via hindering sperm function and count, but does not influence testosterone or libido 7. Bacosides) has been implicated in working synergistically with one of the four (or more) following ingredients. [Curcumin](/supplements/curcumin/), [Green Tea catechins](/supplements/green-tea-extract/) components act in a dose-dependent manner, and at a concentration of 20ug/mL only curcumin was significantly different from baseline in isolation when looking at Heme-Oxygenase 1 promoter activity (at approximately 400% of baseline) whereas Prostandim at the same concentration was at 900% baseline. Induction of HO-1 was 10-fold in Prostandim relative to 2-fold in curcumin and non-significant in the other molecules. [[93]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-93) Removal of either Ashwagandha, Bacopa, and Green tea resulted in 25-40% reductions in HO-1 promoter activity whereas more dramatic reductions were seen after removal of curcumin or silymarins. [[93]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-93) The results appear to be mediated through nuclear translocation of NRF2 and unbinding from KEAP1. [[93]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-93) This study was partially funded by Protandim's parent company, LifeVantage Corp. [[93]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-93) So, there is synergism amongst these nutrients somehow. No clue exactly which ones and by what mechanisms. Bacopa seems to be lesser important than the other ingredients though. 7.2 Yohimbine Yohimbine is able to antagonize the A2-adrenergic receptor, which appears to be one method by which Bacopa can dull the perception of pain at high doses. Thus Yohimbine appears to antagonize the antinocioreceptive effects of Bacopa Monnieri. [[87]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-87) 7.3 Caffeine A nutrient interaction borne from conjecture (ie. not been tested in a study yet), but due to the ability of Bacopa to hinder spikes of dopamine in the striatum above baseline levels Bacopa may interfere with some cognitive aspects of [caffeine](/supplements/caffeine/) that are experienced by naive users. Adenosine antagonism and the anti-sleep effects should not be affected. 7.4 Perment Perment is a brand name for 500mg of four herbs of Ayurveda in equal Monnieri, to be synergistic with each other in at least one (independent) study. [[94]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-94) In an animal model of Chronic unpredictable manageable stress (which effectively induces anxiety and depression), the Perment ratio was administered at 75, 150, and 300mg/kg bodyweight for 21 days alongside stressors was able to negate stress-eating (no dose-response), was about as potent than Diazepam (2mg/kg) at normalizing neurotransmitter levels, and less potent at reducing [anxiety](/conditions/anxiety/). [[94]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-94) Perment appeared to be more catered towards anti-depressive effects than anti-anxiety effects in this study, and no evidence was put forward for synergism between the molecules. [[94]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-94) 8. Safety and Toxicity 8.1 Animals Animal studies have used doses up to 80mg/kg bodyweight for up to 8 weeks and noted no biochemical side effects. One study used 250mg/kg bodyweight [[95]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-95) and did not note any metabolic abnormalities (although did not actively seek them out either) whereas another study using this same dose (250mg/kg) daily in male mice for 56 days noted no significant health effects, but did notice anti-fertility actions by impairing sperm function, which was reversed 56 days after cessation of Bacopa. [[90]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-90) 8.2 Humans One study using 300mg daily in older adults noted more gastrointestinal side-effects (cramping and nausea) than placebo. [[36]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-36) Other studies also note upset stomachs that are routinely different than placebo [[34]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-34) [[96]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-96) and one study noted increased diarrhea. [[37]](/supplements/bacopa-monnieri/research/#ref-37) At this moment in time, these remain the only adverse effect noted in humans. No significant case studies exist.
